domain_features.combined_text: Imitation Learning Imitation Learning Imitation Learning The paper discusses multiple contributions to improve imitation learning in robotics, specifically through kinesthetic teaching and learned mode switching. In this paper, we investigate how to leverage visuotactile sensing for imitation learning (IL) on a real robotic platform for contact-rich manipulation tasks.

instances.title: Multimodal and Force-Matched Imitation Learning with a See-Through Visuotactile Sensor
instances.justification: The paper discusses multiple contributions to improve imitation learning in robotics, specifically through kinesthetic teaching and learned mode switching.

domain_features.combined_text: Tactile Sensing Tactile Sensing Tactile Sensing The research leverages a see-through visuotactile sensor for contact feedback in robotic manipulation, making tactile sensing a significant aspect of the study. A recently-introduced see-through-your-skin (STS) multimodal optical sensor variant combines visual sensing with tactile sensing by leveraging a transparent membrane and controllable lighting.

domain_features.combined_text:
Machine Learning Machine Learning Machine Learning The research heavily uses machine learning strategies, particularly supervised learning, to improve optimization heuristics. Our method feeds a prediction from a machine learning (ML) model to a Local Search (LS) algorithm. The paper emphasizes the integration of deep learning and machine learning techniques in processing and analyzing lensing simulations. Machine learning will be critical to achieve the necessary speed to process these
lenses, it will also be needed to meet the complexity of strong lens modelling.

domain_features.combined_text: Mobile Health Mobile Health Mobile Health The SAM application is a mobile health tool designed to enhance medication adherence, fitting within the mobile health research domain. Smart About Meds (SAM) is a pilot-­tested, patient-centred mobile application that leverages the Information–Motivation–Behavioural Skills Model to provide an array of features.

domain_features.combined_text: Pharmacoeconomics Pharmacoeconomics Pharmacoeconomics The study aims to reduce potentially inappropriate medication use and improve medication adherence, impacting healthcare costs, which links to pharmacoeconomics. Targeting non­adherence while raising patient awareness to PIMs may have a synergistic effect because elimination of PIMs will reduce the number of drugs in a patient’s regimen and associated costs.

domain_features.combined_text: Temporal Graphs Temporal Graphs Temporal Graphs The paper establishes a framework specifically for temporal graphs and conducts experiments on temporal datasets, reflecting this focus. In this paper, we introduce Unified Temporal Graph (UTG), a framework that unifies snapshot-based and event-based machine learning models under a single umbrella.

instances.title: UTG: Towards a Unified View of Snapshot and Event Based Models for Temporal Graphs
